page.title: 03A NEW HOUSING ESTATE
page.content: We did a survey about the new housing estate at{Forstersteads}in Allendale. The firm building this estate was { Newmans.We interviewed six people altogether, the first person was the foreman on the site. These are our results. The wood that was used to build the houses was{spruce,}they used {tiles}on the roof. They have steetly bricks which they get from{Throckley} {Brickworks.}They use half a tonne of cement in one day, they use sand which they get from{Corbridge.}About one thousand gallons of water is used in the building of one house. The houses cost around forty thousand pounds. But of course it depends on the size. There will only be twenty builders on the site at any one time, they work nine hours a day. It takes about ten weeks to build one house, there will be{thirty-two}houses
